intro: Humata vestita, commonly known as the clothed humata, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that give it its common name. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Humata vestita is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
